means: 安排（bill的过去式与过去分词形式）

sentence.Network_en: She was billed to play the Red Queen in Snow White.
sentence.Network_cn: 海报宣传她会扮演《白雪公主》中的“红王后”。

sentence.Network_en: It's been billed as the race of the year.
sentence.Network_cn: 海报上宣传这是本年度的大赛.

sentence.Network_en: The new actor was billed for this week.
sentence.Network_cn: 这位新演员已贴出海报,本周登台献艺.

PerfectNetExp.abs: The ivory - billed woodpecker , long thought to be extinct , turned out not to be ., 长久以来被认为已经灭绝的象牙喙啄木鸟 , 其实并未绝种.
You will be billed a lump - sum that includes the length of your payment terms ., 你将水费一次性付款 , 包括你的长度计算.
She is billed to lecture tonight ., 海报预告她今晚演讲.
she is billed to as Jane .据海报说，她扮演简爱。

entry.def: -billed combines with adjectives to indicate that a bird has a beak of a particular kind or appearance.

means.word_mean: 1. having a beak or bill as specified;

auth_sentence.content: The trip was billed as a Polar Bear Safari.
auth_sentence.res_content: The trip was billed as a Polar Bear Safari.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The trip was billed as a Polar Bear Safari.

auth_sentence.content: The Skirball performance had been billed as featuring Glass.

auth_sentence.content: The countries were billed for several million dollars.

Sentence.sentence: The residents are billed by "net metering": they pay for the amount of power they tap off the grid, less the kilowatts (千瓦) they feed into it.
How are the residents in the ZEH communities billed for electricity use
When people billed their time by ninety dollars an hour they report feeling far more priced for time.
